intro: Alstonia cuneata, commonly known as the African candlewood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, candle-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, elongated panicles. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Alstonia cuneata is typically found in forested areas and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters.
